TopicTitle: 1.0.5 is out!!!!! post your fist craft here.

Articles.Content:
http://i.imgur.com/gPZ5soh.jpg

\o/

needs more fuel

hey man loving the new parts and looks.

Built myself this mini-shuttle. At $35,000, she's probably not that economical as I have rockets that can do the same job and get about the same value recovered, but I'm still tweaking things. But economics are one thing; She works very well thus far, aside from some foibles I should be able to correct.

More than enough delta-v to get to orbit...I know that because one of the problems is that until she gets to over 20K meters, even trying to start a gravity turn starts the whole thing cartwheeling. But I can probably fix that and she had enough fuel to make orbit anyway, as you can see below.

I just allllmost made it to orbit solely on the boosters followed by the Skipper. If I can do that with the cartwheel, I might be able to hold onto some of big tanks fuel until she's in orbit and have the entire fuel load for the 909 to go places if I can fly her normally all the way up. I ended up in a 100x100 orbit with about 3/4 of a tank or so and did NOT do my best piloting job ever getting up there.

Reentry went fine, and the little jets worked great once I got to lower altitude. On the other hand...

...I may need to work on my landing gear's stability. Think the footprints...a little narrow for me...

Edited November 10, 2015 by Captain Vlad

Although I like the new parts, 1.0.5 is for me a huge disappointment. Performance has dropped even further, the stock turbines are dead again, the stock submarine I built won't dive anymore.

On the bright side, I've updated my BUFF2 with the Goliath engine. Speed has increased with ~50 m/s

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I'm wonder what the FAR versions will do.

And because I always loved this plane but waited for a good cockpit, here's a replica of a Beechcraft Starship. Top speed: 173.2 m/s, which is awfully similar to the original (172.7 m/s)

the stock turbines are dead again

Wait... what do you mean?

I still haven't gotten my hands on 1.0.5, but perhaps the first thing I would do is check if my main ships are still working. Then I'd fool around with the new parts.

First in with a learjet

http://i.imgur.com/t4yjsi7.png

Nope, that's a Citation. Here's a Learjet:

Lears have a very characteristic T-shaped tail with "swallow"-style winglets underneath. Cessna's have a more classic cross-shaped tail.

So far, 1.05 is going swimmingly (Other than my worst fears about the MkI cockpit being true ):

Rune. I've waited SO long to do that.

Do you mean it is uggly? It doesn't fit my YF-12 so much as i thought

Not really. But it doesn't belong in space! I had a ton of stuff that relied on the perfectly up-to-date "old" Mk I cockpit, and all the designs with that are ruined pending a rebuild. I know I'm not going to use the new one much... and it didn't have to replace the old one. I think it's my one big disappointment with this update. Which is awesome in pretty much all other respects.

Rune. Ok, maybe the Vector is a bit OP.
